newsitem.title: FRANCE: Sagem eyes Thomson Multimedia - paper.
newsitem.headline: Sagem eyes Thomson Multimedia - paper.

text.p: French electronics company Sagem is trying to gather a group of industrial and financial partners to bid for television maker Thomson Multimedia, to rival an offer from South Korea's Daewoo Electronics, daily newspaper Liberation reported on Tuesday.

"Stricken by the government's choice of the Matra -Daewoo partnership, Pierre Faure, chairman of Sagem, seems to be putting together a group of industrial and financial companies capable of making an offer for Thomson," the report said.
French paper La Tribune reported on Monday an unnamed French businessman was putting up a rival bid to Daewoo.
Sagem later issued an emphatic denial of the newspaper report.

"Following erroneous information published in the daily newspaper Liberation this morning, Sagem denies any interest, and what is more, any negotiations or any contact concerning Thomson Multimedia," Sagem said in a statement.
Liberation reported that Sagem had apparently been working with Thomson Multimedia's chairman Alain Prestat since last Wednesday to make an offer which would "torpedo" Daewoo's.
A finance ministry spokesman on Monday said the government had not received a third bid for Thomson Multimedia.
The government has chosen Lagardere's bid for the Thomson SA group and plans to sell the Multimedia unit to Daewoo while keeping the defence electronics arm, Thomson-CSF .
A rival bid from engineering giant Alcatel Alsthom was passed over.
Sagem is active in telecommunications and aerospace avionics.
